summary: And you think your family has problems… There’s nothing quite like a claim to the throne that will cause some familial...
body:
And you think your family has problems… There’s nothing quite like a claim to the throne that will cause some familial disagreements. Here’s your first look at Mary Queen of Scots!

To say that things between these two ladies was strained would be an understatement, but the history between Elizabeth I and Mary Stuart is insanely compelling. Both woman attained and maintained power in a man’s world during a time when that wasn’t favorable.

“Mary Queen of Scots” explores the turbulent life of the charismatic Mary Stuart (Ronan). Queen of France at 16 and widowed at 18, Mary defies pressure to remarry. Instead, she returns to her native Scotland to reclaim her rightful throne. But Scotland and England fall under the rule of the compelling Elizabeth I (Robbie). Each young Queen beholds her “sister” in fear and fascination. Rivals in power and in love, and female regents in a masculine world, the two must decide how to play the game of marriage versus independence. Determined to rule as much more than a figurehead, Mary asserts her claim to the English throne, threatening Elizabeth’s sovereignty. Betrayal, rebellion, and conspiracies within each court imperil both thrones – and change the course of history. {Via Focus Features}

With strong personalities, comes strong conflict. Take a look at the trailer and see what I mean!

We can’t wait to see Robbie and Ronan in these roles. Their commanding presence on screen will be hard for critic to ignore, too. What do you think so far? Let us know in the comments!

Credit: Liam Daniel / Focus Features
Credit: Parisa Tag / Focus Features
Credit: John Mathieson / Focus Features

 

FIRST LOOK: ‘Mary Queen of Scots’ Debuts Official Posters + First Trailer And you think your family has problems… There’s nothing quite like a claim to the throne that will cause some familial disagreements.

trail.content:
And you think your family has problems… There’s nothing quite like a claim to the throne that will cause some familial disagreements. Here’s your first look at Mary Queen of Scots!

To say that things between these two ladies was strained would be an understatement, but the history between Elizabeth I and Mary Stuart is insanely compelling. Both woman attained and maintained power in a man’s world during a time when that wasn’t favorable.

“Mary Queen of Scots” explores the turbulent life of the charismatic Mary Stuart (Ronan). Queen of France at 16 and widowed at 18, Mary defies pressure to remarry. Instead, she returns to her native Scotland to reclaim her rightful throne. But Scotland and England fall under the rule of the compelling Elizabeth I (Robbie). Each young Queen beholds her “sister” in fear and fascination. Rivals in power and in love, and female regents in a masculine world, the two must decide how to play the game of marriage versus independence. Determined to rule as much more than a figurehead, Mary asserts her claim to the English throne, threatening Elizabeth’s sovereignty. Betrayal, rebellion, and conspiracies within each court imperil both thrones – and change the course of history. {Via Focus Features}

With strong personalities, comes strong conflict. Take a look at the trailer and see what I mean!

summary: Trailer Park: Mary, Queen of Scots
title: Trailer Park: Mary, Queen of Scots
body:
Trailer Park: Saoirse Ronan and Margot Robbie go head-to-head in #MaryQueenofScots:

Academy Award nominees Saoirse Ronan and Margot Robbie star in Mary, Queen of Scots, which is directed by Donmar Warehouse artistic director Josie Rourke.

Based on John Guy‘s biography My Heart Is My Own: The Life of Mary Queen, the film explores the turbulent life of the charismatic Mary Stuart (Ronan). Queen of France at 16 and widowed at 18, Mary defies pressure to remarry. Instead, she…

tags: idk if thats how you reacted but thats def how i reacted
we’re just so thirsty for new content and i support that a lot
body:
Mary Queen of Scots trailer

Everyone who’s a fan of every other actor in the film: “Wow that’s such a good close up, I love seeing all of them interact with each other this time and not just see the set and promo pics.”

David Tennant fans: *hears his voice for 9 seconds and sees .5 clip of him from a shot that’s 5 ft away* “OHHHHHHHH MY GOD OHHHH MY GOD IT’S HIM ISHWHISHAOAHAI EVERYONE LOOK!!!!!!”

summary: Video of the Day - The Last Leg, 2018 - Blogtor Who
title: Video of the Day - The Last Leg, 2018 - Blogtor Who
The Doctor and Rose
body:
The Doctor and Rose

Over a decade ago, David Tennant and Billie Piper acted out some very emotional scenes as Dr Who and Rose.

The episode left them living apart, stuck in a parallel universe to each other.

It struck me today that this happened the same year as my son was first diagnosed with Cancer. Since then, there has always been “time before” and “time after” that day.

My “normal” existence came to a halt and…

View On WordPress
